metadata.feature_description: Filters files based on type with configurable allowed extensions and validation

steps.action: Navigate to Assets panel and enter '.png' in the search box
steps.expected: Only PNG image files should be displayed
steps.actual: Search returned only PNG files (batch_image_3.png, Bronze-Gettingstarted.png, cavalier-tv.png, etc.) with thumbnails showing. Breadcrumb displayed 'Search .PNG'

steps.action: Enter '.xml' in the search box to filter XML document files
steps.expected: XML document files should be displayed (e.g., Dnn.CKEditorSettings.xml)
steps.actual: Search returned 'Your Search Produced No Results' despite XML files being visible in the folder listing

issues: Search/filter functionality does not index non-image file types. XML, CSS, and TXT files cannot be filtered using the search box despite being visible in the folder listing.

steps.expected: PNG files should be returned regardless of case
steps.actual: Search returned the same PNG files as lowercase '.png' search, confirming case-insensitive filtering works

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify file type display in details

steps.action: Hover over cavalier-logo.png file and click the edit (pencil) button to open file details
steps.expected: File details panel should display the file type/extension
steps.actual: File details panel opened showing 'Type: png' along with other metadata (Created date, Size: 2.0 KB, Last Modified, URL). File type is clearly displayed.

observations: No dedicated 'Filter Options' UI panel exists at the specified location 'Admin > Content > Assets > Filter Options'. File type filtering is implemented through the search functionality.
The search/filter feature only indexes image files (PNG, JPG, etc.). Non-image file types (XML, CSS, TXT, DOCX, PDF) are visible in the folder listing but cannot be filtered via search by extension.
Different file types display with appropriate icons in the file listing: image files show thumbnails, XML files show </> code icons, document files show document icons.

Code review shows file type filtering for uploads is implemented server-side via GetFileUploadToken method with a Filter parameter for allowed extensions, but this is not exposed in the Assets browser UI.
The file details panel correctly displays the file type (extension) under 'Type:' field when viewing file properties.
